alert.note: Alert for Grayson; Hardin (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued March 06 at 8:42PM EST until further notice by NWS Louisville
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1145 PM EST/1045 PM CST/ THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of CENTRAL Kentucky, including the following counties, Bullitt, Hardin, Nelson, and Grayson. * WHEN...Until 1145 PM EST /1045 PM CST/. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 841 PM EST /741 PM CST/, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Up to 2 inches of rain have already fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Elizabethtown, Radcliff, Vine Grove, Lebanon Junction, Long View, Rineyville, Kraft, Addington Field Airport, Saint John and Rogersville. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
